meanings.definition: To obtain information from multiple sources.
meanings.sent1: I multisource my research by using books, websites, and interviews.
meanings.sent2: Journalists often multisource their articles to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to multisource his investigation by talking to different witnesses.
meanings.sent4: She likes to multisource her recipes, combining ideas from various cookbooks.
meanings.sent5: To write a comprehensive report, it is important to multisource your data.

meanings.sent1: The multisource approach provided a well-rounded perspective on the issue.
meanings.sent2: A multisource study is more reliable than one that relies on a single document.
meanings.sent3: The multisource team worked together to gather information from various places.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style is multisource, drawing inspiration from different authors.
meanings.sent5: The multisource nature of the project ensured a diverse range of opinions.
